userStories.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
Whatâ€™s your best coping strategy?
userStories.tip: I've tried many medications, and they all wax and wane in their effectiveness. Lately, I've been trying out cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) to control my symptoms, and have been impressed with how well it seems to be working for me.

userStories.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
userStories.tip: Symptoms might get better or worse as your get older, but you'll learn how to deal with them well. With time, a lot of people with Tourette's can figure out how to lead normal, happy lives.

condition.description:
If you have Tourette syndrome, you make unusual movements or sounds, called tics. You have little or no control over them. Common tics are throat-clearing and blinking. You may repeat words, spin, or, rarely, blurt out swear words.

Tourette syndrome is a disorder of the nervous system. It often occurs with other problems, such as

  • Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD)
  • Obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD)
  • Anxiety
  • Depression

The cause of Tourette syndrome is unknown. It is more common in boys than girls. The tics usually start in childhood and may be worst in the early teens. Many people eventually outgrow them.

No treatment is needed unless the tics interfere with everyday life. Excitement or worry can make tics worse. Calm, focused activities may make them better. Medicines and talk therapy may also help.

NIH: National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke
condition.name: Tourette syndrome

carousel_items: It'll take 4 to 6 weeks to see the medication's full effects on your thoughts.
It can cause dizziness, drowsiness, and can lower your blood pressure.
For the first week, avoid activities like driving that require you to be alert.
Immediately tell your doctor if you can't control your muscle movements or if you have a fever or excess sweating.
Don't use in elderly people who have dementia.
The oral liquid concentrate can be mixed with water or juice before taking it.

basics.benefits_moa: Haloperidol is a traditional antipsychotic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it seems to change dopamine activity in your brain, which affects thoughts and mood.
basics.bottom_line: Haloperidol is okay for treating psychosis and agitation. It's less likely to cause weight gain than other antipsychotics, but it's more likely to cause other bad side effects.
downsides: It's an older medicine and has a lot more side effects than newer antipsychotics.
Compared to other antipsychotics, it causes more hormone problems that can cause nipples to leak fluid, and sudden, dangerous abnormal heart rhythms.

Has a higher risk of extrapyramidal symptoms (EPS): movement disorders that include stiffness, tremor, restlessness, and slow, repetitive, or involuntary movements. One of these symptoms (called tardive dyskinesia) is permanent and more likely if you take this medicine for many years.
You might need routine blood tests to check how the medicine is affecting your body.
All antipsychotics have side effects that make them difficult to take. You might need to try a few different medicines until you find one that works best for you.

downsides_processed.orig: It's an older medicine and has a lot more side effects than newer antipsychotics.
Compared to other antipsychotics, it causes more hormone problems that can cause nipples to leak fluid, and sudden, dangerous abnormal heart rhythms.

Has a higher risk of extrapyramidal symptoms (EPS): movement disorders that include stiffness, tremor, restlessness, and slow, repetitive, or involuntary movements. One of these symptoms (called tardive dyskinesia) is permanent and more likely if you take this medicine for many years.
You might need routine blood tests to check how the medicine is affecting your body.
All antipsychotics have side effects that make them difficult to take. You might need to try a few different medicines until you find one that works best for you.

upsides: Effective at relieving psychotic symptoms and agitation.
Works just as well as other antipsychotic medicines.
Less likely to cause weight gain and problems with cholesterol and blood sugar than most other antipsychotics.

upsides_processed.orig: Effective at relieving psychotic symptoms and agitation.
Works just as well as other antipsychotic medicines.
Less likely to cause weight gain and problems with cholesterol and blood sugar than most other antipsychotics.

drugs.one_liner: Helps control your thoughts and calms agitation.
drugs.name: Haldol

carousel_items_processed.orig: It'll take 4 to 6 weeks to see the medication's full effects on your thoughts.
It can cause dizziness, drowsiness, and can lower your blood pressure.
For the first week, avoid activities like driving that require you to be alert.
Immediately tell your doctor if you can't control your muscle movements or if you have a fever or excess sweating.
Don't use in elderly people who have dementia.
The oral liquid concentrate can be mixed with water or juice before taking it.

risks_warnings.title: Increased risk of death
risks_warnings.description: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Haloperidol is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

description_processed.orig: Older patients with dementia-related psychosis have a higher risk of death when treated with antipsychotic medications. Haloperidol is not approved to treat dementia-related psychosis.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: Rarely, Haloperidol can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away. You may need routine blood tests while on this medication.

description_processed.orig: Rarely, Haloperidol can lower white blood cell counts. White blood cells help your body fight infections. Tell your doctor if you have any infection symptoms (such as fever, sore throat, or mouth/throat swelling) that don't go away. You may need routine blood tests while on this medication.

risks_warnings.title: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome
risks_warnings.description: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic (neuroleptic) medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, full body stiffness, and confusion. Seek medical attention immediately.

description_processed.orig: This is a rare but life-threatening condition associated with all antipsychotic (neuroleptic) medications. Symptoms include high fever, fast heart rate, full body stiffness, and confusion. Seek medical attention immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Haloperidol can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. However, Haloperidol causes fewer heart problems compared to some antipsychotic medications. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

description_processed.orig: Haloperidol can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat. However, Haloperidol causes fewer heart problems compared to some antipsychotic medications. Heart and blood tests may be required before starting treatment.

risks_warnings.title: Shaking and restlessness
risks_warnings.description: Haloperidol can cause uncontrollable shaking, muscle stiffness, or feeling very restless. Haloperidol is more likely to cause these symptoms compared to other antipsychotic medications. Tell your doctor if you experience any abnormal movements or restlessness.

description_processed.orig: Haloperidol can cause uncontrollable shaking, muscle stiffness, or feeling very restless. Haloperidol is more likely to cause these symptoms compared to other antipsychotic medications. Tell your doctor if you experience any abnormal movements or restlessness.

risks_warnings.title: Higher blood sugar and cholesterol
risks_warnings.description: Haloperidol can increase your blood sugar and cholesterol. However, Haloperidol is less likely to raise your blood sugar and cholesterol compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

description_processed.orig: Haloperidol can increase your blood sugar and cholesterol. However, Haloperidol is less likely to raise your blood sugar and cholesterol compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

risks_warnings.title: Weight gain
risks_warnings.description: Haloperidol can cause you to gain weight. However, Haloperidol is less likely to cause weight gain compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

description_processed.orig: Haloperidol can cause you to gain weight. However, Haloperidol is less likely to cause weight gain compared to other antipsychotic medications. Exercise and eat healthy food to lower your risk.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Haloperidol impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Haloperidol impairs your ability to focus, think, and react. Be careful. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness and falls may occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.

description_processed.orig: Dizziness and falls may occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.

carousel_items: Takes 4 to 6 weeks to see full effects on thoughts and mood.
For the first week, avoid activities that require you to be alert.
May cause weight gain and worsen cholesterol or blood sugar.
Report any unusual thoughts, inability to control muscle movements, or fever and excess sweating to your doctor.
Elderly people with dementia shouldn't take it.

basics.benefits_moa: Risperdal is an atypical antipsychotic. Researchers don't know exactly how it works. It seems to change dopamine and serotonin activity in your brain, which affects thoughts and mood.
basics.bottom_line: Risperdal is good for treating psychosis, mania, and irritability. Among newer antipsychotic medicines, more likely to cause side effects, especially weight gain and hormone problems.
downsides: Mild to moderate risk of Extrapyramidal Symptoms (EPS): Movement disorders that include stiffness, tremor, restlessness, and slow, repetitive, or involuntary movements.
Moderate risk of weight gain and problems with cholesterol or blood sugar compared to other antipsychotics.
Compared to other antipsychotics, higher risk of hormone problems that cause nipples to leak and male breasts to grow abnormally large.
You might need routine blood tests to check how the medicine is affecting your body.
All antipsychotics come with side effects that make them difficult to take. You might need to try a few different medicines until you find one that works for you and that you can tolerate.

downsides_processed.orig: Mild to moderate risk of Extrapyramidal Symptoms (EPS): Movement disorders that include stiffness, tremor, restlessness, and slow, repetitive, or involuntary movements.
Moderate risk of weight gain and problems with cholesterol or blood sugar compared to other antipsychotics.
Compared to other antipsychotics, higher risk of hormone problems that cause nipples to leak and male breasts to grow abnormally large.
You might need routine blood tests to check how the medicine is affecting your body.
All antipsychotics come with side effects that make them difficult to take. You might need to try a few different medicines until you find one that works for you and that you can tolerate.

upsides: Effective at relieving psychotic symptoms, manic episodes, irritability, and aggressive behavior.
Lowers relapse rates in people with schizophrenia and people with irritability associated with autism.
Antipsychotic medicines are all about equally effective.
Less likely to cause heart problems than some antipsychotics.

upsides_processed.orig: Effective at relieving psychotic symptoms, manic episodes, irritability, and aggressive behavior.
Lowers relapse rates in people with schizophrenia and people with irritability associated with autism.
Antipsychotic medicines are all about equally effective.
Less likely to cause heart problems than some antipsychotics.

drugs.one_liner: Helps control your thoughts and mood.

userStories.tip:
If you are on multiple medications be aware that the risk of serious side effects are higher. 
As soon as you experience any EPS take a dose of Benadryl & if that doesn't work go see your doctor asap or the hospital for a shot of Cogentin.

userStories.identifier: Mother of two sons and Synchro swimmer
userStories.tip: I take it only twice a week .5 at a time for prevention of break through symptoms. I experience only about 1-2# weight gain that I can work off the rest of the week. When I am in a serious state of mania, I take 1-3mg day. This ALWAYS works
Too many side effects for me, had to stop. Caused blurry vision, weight gain, and a slew of other crap.
Take smaller doses throughout the day to avoid negative side effects.

drugs.name: Risperdal

off-label_indications.indication: Behavioral symptoms associated with mental retardation

carousel_items: Don't stop taking Tenex without talking to your doctor first.
Limit the amount of alcohol you drink while taking this.
Drink plenty of liquids and don't get overheated while taking Tenex.
You can feel sleepy the first few times you take it, or when your dose is increased. Don't drive or do anything that requires concentration until you know how the medication affects your body.
Can take up to 2 weeks for the maximum effect.

basics.benefits_moa: Tenex is a centrally-acting alpha agonist medication. It lowers blood pressure by slowing down the heart rate and relaxing the blood vessels. It's not clear how Tenex works in ADHD, but it's used when stimulants haven't worked or can't be used in people.
basics.bottom_line: Tenex can be used to treat both blood pressure and ADHD, but it's not recommended as a first-line treatment for either problem.
downsides: Doesn't control ADHD as well as stimulants do, so it's used as a second-line medication.
Not a preferred drug to control blood pressure.
Can't be stopped suddenly, especially for blood pressure, since the blood pressure can dramatically increase.

downsides_processed.orig: Doesn't control ADHD as well as stimulants do, so it's used as a second-line medication.
Not a preferred drug to control blood pressure.
Can't be stopped suddenly, especially for blood pressure, since the blood pressure can dramatically increase.

upsides: The same medication treats two different things, high blood pressure and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).
Used to control ADHD when stimulant medications haven't worked or can't be used due to other medical problems.
Available as a generic medication, so it should be more affordable than other options.

upsides_processed.orig: The same medication treats two different things, high blood pressure and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD).
Used to control ADHD when stimulant medications haven't worked or can't be used due to other medical problems.
Available as a generic medication, so it should be more affordable than other options.

drugs.one_liner: Treats ADHD and lowers blood pressure.

userStories.tip:
Excellent choice for non-stimulant
Reduced my son's aggressive tantrums, allowed his to filter and his speech became more articulate
My son takes it in the evening. Seems to help him sleep and lessens the frequency of night terrors. Daytime he is more focused and has less frequent/severe behaviours.

drugs.name: Tenex

carousel_items_processed.orig: Don't stop taking Tenex without talking to your doctor first.
Limit the amount of alcohol you drink while taking this.
Drink plenty of liquids and don't get overheated while taking Tenex.
You can feel sleepy the first few times you take it, or when your dose is increased. Don't drive or do anything that requires concentration until you know how the medication affects your body.
Can take up to 2 weeks for the maximum effect.

risks_warnings.title: Sedation
risks_warnings.description: People report having sleepiness or sedation while on Tenex. You're at higher risk for this if you're taking other medications that have similar effects. Don't drive or do anything that requires concentration until you know how Tenex affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medications that cause sedation or sleepiness

description_processed.orig: People report having sleepiness or sedation while on Tenex. You're at higher risk for this if you're taking other medications that have similar effects. Don't drive or do anything that requires concentration until you know how Tenex affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Rebound high blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: You're at risk for having seriously high blood pressure if you decide to stop taking Tenex suddenly, especially if you're taking this to control your blood pressure. You can also be at higher risk for stroke or heart attack. If Tenex isn't working for you and you decide to stop taking it, talk to your doctor about how to best lower the risk of rebound high blood pressure while stopping this medication.
risk_factors: Stopping Tenex suddenly to treat high blood pressure

description_processed.orig: You're at risk for having seriously high blood pressure if you decide to stop taking Tenex suddenly, especially if you're taking this to control your blood pressure. You can also be at higher risk for stroke or heart attack. If Tenex isn't working for you and you decide to stop taking it, talk to your doctor about how to best lower the risk of rebound high blood pressure while stopping this medication.
